content.description: jugs on up.
content.location: Far right end of the STRUTH BOULDER. It is the easy climb right of the engraving in the rock. Do not step on or near the engraving, palease.

content.description: There is decent sized piece of rock with lots of warm-ups basically 50 feet up the hill from the Stinger boulder, and more or less on your way to the Big Time boulder.
There is decent sized piece of rock with lots of warm-ups basically 50 feet up the hill from the Stinger boulder, and more or less on your way to the Big Time boulder.
There is decent sized piece of rock with lots of warm-ups basically 50 feet up the hill from the Stinger boulder, and more or less on your way to the Big Time boulder.

Sit start on a sort of obvious jug slopeyish hold. Move up to crimps just at the base of the roof. Move out to the flake in the roof. Move off the flake over the lip and into the top-out slab. Pull out.
content.protection: crashpad and a spotter. There is back-fall type potential on this problem so get a spotter and some paddage.

content.description: Start on the left side of the face on an obvious start hold/rail thing. Move up to the arête and the surf up right on the arête to the top.
content.location: Block below the Big Time boulder

content.description: This is variation to Stinger Arete. Climber Stinger until you reach the horizontal in the overhang. Traverse left into the overhang and set up for a dyno to the finish of Stinger

sit start low. The holds on your way up are rather directional. The are sort of interspersed with holds used on the Steve E. Wonder Arete but I find they don't use the same holds because you are pulling in different directions. Get to the ledge, mantle up and subtly reach over the top to find something to stand up with. The top out.
sit start, climb the left leaning arete all the way until you are rolling up onto the top. Do not roll up right and out, follow it around left as far as seems reasonable.
content.location:
This overhang is directly uphill of the Balcony Jr cliff top boulder (Floater Boulder) where Blubber Shuffle is found. 

SUGAR BOULDER

content.description: Sit start at the base of the arete. Move upward. You nearly always have a right hand around the arete helping you balance and squeeze.
ss, start at right facing corner and go up towards the arete. Use it to make a long move to a horizontal. Problem can be done without the arete too.

Climb the 10' high bulging face up to the alcove and right of the tree.  Follow the wide crack on the left facing wall up to the roof.  Move left using the obvious lip of the overhang till about 3 feet from the outer left edge.  Head straight up to the top.
content.protection: A rope is a good idea, with ~40' top system.
content.location: About 60 feet behind the Top of the Throne Boulder.

content.description: climb up on the far left side of the boulder.
Sit start, move to a vertical crimp [broken, 12/2015] on a left facing mini corner, and move upward to a horizontal and then top out

A very long time ago, a sloper fetish led to groping of these downsloping ramps. The grade is a guess and I think the "holds" are friction itself. Sit on the rock slab and pull onto the bottom ramp and work up these downsloping ramps. I think being short helps because you aren't as jammed up at the start. Needs some modern/updated beta.
Climb the arete from a sit start.

Though it isn't much of a problem in length it has some cool holds and moves. Sit start on the SE arete on the Starlight Boulder. Tuck up under the overhang with a match on a sloper rail. Pull off the ground and get a right heel hook up right a little higher than your starting hold. It's almost inverted slightly. Move your right hand up to a sloping pinch that feels so cool to grab. Then work out left and top out.
content.location:
SE arete on the Starlight Boulder 

STARLIGHT BOULDER

content.description: Use whatever holds you would like along the seam/crack and climb upward exiting left most likely.
content.location:
left of the Squinch 

STRUTH BOULDER

content.description: Begins low with a vertical crimp for the left hand and your right hand is on the downsloping crimper rail in the face. This is also the start for Learning To Fly.  Basically traverse up and left to Dans Arete but instead of staying on the arete you will just escape left around the corner and up the slab.

Begins low with a vertical crimp for the left hand and your right hand is on the downsloping crimper rail in the face. This is also the start for Learning To Fly.   This problem moves up left to join Dans Arete. From the right hand crimper rail work your left hand out and up left until you can bring your right hand in to a hold just above the two finger slot used by Learning To Fly. At this point you are squeezing a little. Then move into the jug on Dans Arete and finish out.
Sit start same as Butter Balls but veer right at the lip.
content.location:
right side of the  

BIG PINE CAVE

content.description: Start on the chalked jugs and then move up obvious holds until you can make a big move to get your right hand into a sidepull in the crack, then keep trucking to the top.(possible prior FA, but this seemed to be different than the existing lines listed here)
content.location: The middle crack in the Big Pine Cave.

content.description: sit start at the jug on the left side of the mouth of the cave on the east side of the Starlight Boulder. On this mini arete with a nice starting jug angle up left to roll out into a mantle. Great moves, great holds.
Air it out a little on jugs. Face with horizontal jugs.
content.location:
West side of the throne. 

THRONE BOULDER

content.description:
Just right of Big Dog. Follow the left facing "corner/rail" 

STARLIGHT BOULDER

Start on the jug on the mini arete on the left side of the cave under the Starlight Boulder. Climb straight up and out, not angling left towards Orion's Belt and not traversing rightward like the Big Dipper. All jugs.

Sometime before June 2019 the flake in the roof was ripped off. The problem can no longer be climbed from the original start. A stand start is still doable but the grade is unknown. 

 ORIGINAL: Start low under the roof on jug rail. Move into the roof to a flake hold that sticks down from the roof and faces downhill towards the river. Then move to crimps at the base of the face and then work your way up through the face to top out.
content.location:
Left side of the  

BIG PINE CAVE

content.description: Starts on the downsloping hold in the smooth overhanging face. Finishing up and out left is the original exit though the line could be done straight up (slightly rightward) to increase the head game and length.

The Iron Pickle. This highball airs it all out. It starts with slab, moves to jugs and overhang, rolls over a lip, and back to slab to finish. Just when you think you've hit the end of the road and it doesn't seem iike the route continues, know that there is a hidden hold right where you need it. Climb the slab, get the jugs in the overhang, make the long reach out to the secret hold, grab a crimp on the lip a bit higher than the jug, get your feet up and high step onto the base of the headwall, move through the eyebrows, climb to safety, cheer, thank your spotters, have a beer. By the way, the landing is pretty darn flat and rock free.
content.location: Upper highlands on The Throne Boulder

content.description: It is a short problem but for some reason it's satisfying. You will sit start on a dirt slope, pull on some crimp/flakes and climb up to the topout and mantle out.
content.location:
This is left of Big Dog. It's in the short, overhanging face on the west side of the starlight boulder. 

STARLIGHT BOULDER

content.description: sit start on a jug and go up
Jugs/horizontals on an arete type feature.
content.location: On the rock outcrop left of the Throne boulder

content.description:
sit start on a jug and go up 

STARLIGHT BOULDER
sit start right of the arete on the face.
Sit start under roof, move up to rail, then follow the crack upward to the top.
Start on the pinches in the orange overhanging arete. Climb up. Do not ease left and exit onto the slab or the grade drops.

ss at the base of the arete. Pull on and move almost straight up. There is a nice hold on the edge of the overhang, and a nice small crimp out in the face. High step and rock up. Good classic movement for any climber.   You can also start a little lower by going to the start hold on Two Tacos For Tina and then getting to the arete.
content.location:
on the boulder sitting on the edge of Balcony Jr. on the far left side of the cliff 

FLOATER BOULDER

content.description: Dyno/deadpoint/reach to the top from the rail/crack. It's your choice how to get there but the lip has a great little chicken head type hold that makes this problem fun to the end.
content.location:
It's on the uphill end of the Throne, where Iron Pickle, etc. is located. 

THRONE BOULDER

content.description: Sit start on jugs, climb up and veer left at the lip.
content.location:
right side of the  

BIG PINE CAVE

content.description: Start same as Left's Last Stand or traverse in on the big rail. Then move up with the seams.
climb up, left of the arete

Sit start, pull on jugs the entire way through and over the roof. There is a hold exactly where you want and need it every time. It is a cruise on great holds and the topout holds make the exit a breeze. It's pure pleasure cruising.    Use the jagged mini arete hold that sticks out under the roof to the right of the seam. It is bomber and gets you positioned to reach over the lip to the topout holds.   Calling it a classic because it flows and the holds are so comfy and right where you want/need them.    With the cliffs and scenery in the background you can take a sweet photo and come off looking awesome on the rock :)
It's short. Sit startish and move up to flake/crimp/jug and top out.
content.location:
left end of the Struth boulder. It is left of Seams Easy. 

STRUTH BOULDER

content.description: Start at the flat jug on the arete on the Starlight Boulder. This is the SW arete. Move from the jug to a tiny crimp in quartz and get to the lip and mantle
content.location:
SW arete on the Starlight Boulder 

STARLIGHT BOULDER

content.description: Do not miss. This is all jugs, it's long, it's easy, it's safe. Same start as the Little Dipper and Orion's Belt but travers/climb/angle right all the way uphill to a great roll out onto the top.
Short boulder problem for a sit start.
content.location: On a squat block uphill of the Throne but closer to the Green & White boulder.

content.description: This area offers bouldering and short top ropes up to approximately 30 feet.  There are ample juggy roof problems to hang out on.  Both the Highlands and the Outlying Areas tend to be nesting grounds for buzzards.
